title: How to Make Violet Creams

steps.headline: Add the double cream, a single drop of purple food colouring and the violet syrup to the bowl.
Sift the icing sugar into the cream mixture.
steps.description: Combine by stirring through gently; this forms the fondant for the centre of the violet creams.

steps.headline: Dust a work surface with icing sugar.
steps.description: Place the violet fondant onto the work surface and begin to knead it. Knead until a firm ball forms under your hands.

steps.headline: Wrap the firmed fondant in kitchen plastic wrap.
steps.description: Place into the refrigerator to chill. Leave for around 30 minutes.

steps.headline: Roll the chilled fondant into about 20 balls the size of a teaspoon, using your hands.
steps.description: As each ball is formed, flatten it slightly and set aside on a plate. As it is chilling, line the baking tray with the baking paper or parchment.

steps.headline: Place a bain marie (double boiler) on the stovetop.
steps.description: Heat about 5cm/2" of water in the lower level of the bain marie. Add the dark chocolate and peanut oil in the bowl. Warm the mixture until the chocolate melts. Allow it to cool for 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Dip each fondant ball in the melted chocolate and cover completely.
steps.description: Either use a chocolate dipper or hold the fondant with two forks.

steps.headline: Place the coated violet cream on the baking tray.
steps.description: Place the crystallised violet in the middle of the chocolate topping.

steps.headline: Put into a cool spot to set.

text: Add the double cream, a single drop of purple food colouring and the violet syrup to the bowl. Mix together well. Sift the icing sugar into the cream mixture. Combine by stirring through gently; this forms the fondant for the centre of the violet creams. Dust a work surface with icing sugar. Place the violet fondant onto the work surface and begin to knead it. Knead until a firm ball forms under your hands. Wrap the firmed fondant in kitchen plastic wrap. Place into the refrigerator to chill. Leave for around 30 minutes. Roll the chilled fondant into about 20 balls the size of a teaspoon, using your hands. As each ball is formed, flatten it slightly and set aside on a plate. As it is chilling, line the baking tray with the baking paper or parchment. Place a bain marie (double boiler) on the stovetop. Heat about 5cm/2" of water in the lower level of the bain marie. Add the dark chocolate and peanut oil in the bowl. Warm the mixture until the chocolate melts. Allow it to cool for 10 minutes. Dip each fondant ball in the melted chocolate and cover completely. Either use a chocolate dipper or hold the fondant with two forks. Place the coated violet cream on the baking tray. Place the crystallised violet in the middle of the chocolate topping. Put into a cool spot to set.  Finished.
sentences: Add the double cream, a single drop of purple food colouring and the violet syrup to the bowl.
Mix together well.
Sift the icing sugar into the cream mixture.
Combine by stirring through gently; this forms the fondant for the centre of the violet creams.
Dust a work surface with icing sugar.
Place the violet fondant onto the work surface and begin to knead it.
Knead until a firm ball forms under your hands.
Wrap the firmed fondant in kitchen plastic wrap.
Place into the refrigerator to chill.
Leave for around 30 minutes.
Roll the chilled fondant into about 20 balls the size of a teaspoon, using your hands.
As each ball is formed, flatten it slightly and set aside on a plate.
As it is chilling, line the baking tray with the baking paper or parchment.
Place a bain marie (double boiler) on the stovetop.
Heat about 5cm/2" of water in the lower level of the bain marie.
Add the dark chocolate and peanut oil in the bowl.
Warm the mixture until the chocolate melts.
Allow it to cool for 10 minutes.
Dip each fondant ball in the melted chocolate and cover completely.
Either use a chocolate dipper or hold the fondant with two forks.
Place the coated violet cream on the baking tray.
Place the crystallised violet in the middle of the chocolate topping.
Put into a cool spot to set.
Finished.
